        This method finds all playlists that are stuck in the create failed state.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • clearAllCreateInProcess

        public void clearAllCreateInProcess()
        Description copied from interface: com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylistManager
        This method provides a cleanup, intended to be run during startup, which can fix any invalid states of playlists that were left in the middle of the creation process. 1) If an item is marked as in process, but the asset exists, then the state is changed to CREATED 2) If an item is marked as in process, but an asset does not exist, the state is changed to CREATE_FAILED
        Specified by:
        clearAllCreateInProcess in interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylistManager

      • append

        public boolean append​(IPlaylist playlist)
        Description copied from interface: IPlaylistManager
        Appends to an existing playlist.
        New items are appended to the existing list, but changes to config are not applied once the playlist has been created. Duplicate playlist items are not allowed and will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        append in interface IPlaylistManager
        Parameters:
        playlist - The updated playlist
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful

      • CONTENT_URI

        public Uri CONTENT_URI()
        Description copied from interface: IPlaylistManager
        The Uri used when querying the Content Provider. This is the Uri used for notifications when content changes.
        This Uri can only be used for querying the Content Provider.
        Specified by:
        CONTENT_URI in interface IPlaylistManager
        Returns:
        The Uri

      • getCursor

        public Cursor getCursor()
        Description copied from interface: IPlaylistManager
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        The Cursor will default to retrieving all fields and all rows from the Content provider. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the internal implementation.
        Specified by:
        getCursor in interface IPlaylistManager
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.

      • getCursor

        public Cursor getCursor​(String[] projection,
                        String selection,
                        String[] selectionArgs)
        Description copied from interface: IPlaylistManager
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the internal implementation.
        Specified by:
        getCursor in interface IPlaylistManager
        Parameters:
        projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.

      • getCursor

        public Cursor getCursor​(String[] projection,
                        String selection,
                        String[] selectionArgs,
                        String sort)
        Description copied from interface: IPlaylistManager
        Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
        Specified by:
        getCursor in interface IPlaylistManager
        Parameters:
        projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
        selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
        selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
        sort - How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
